metadata.title: CVE-2023-52524 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:nfc: llcp: Add lock when modifying device list The device list needs itsassociated lock held when modifying it, or the list could become corrupted,as syzbot discovered.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52524` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-254.288
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-254.288
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-254.288
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-225.237~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1132.142
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1169.184
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1177.192~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1162.179~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1131.142~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
